post_text: Bandera I.S.D. has extended the classroom into several of our buses with recently installed WIFI routers purchased using funds from the Technology Lending Grant. Now students can study, learn and collaborate on class assignments with filtered CIPA-compliant internet on the school bus. Our goal is to utilize the time spent on the bus to increase student productivity and lighten the workload when students arrive home - freeing up valuable family and play time. Look for the decals ‚ÄúSmartBus‚Ñ¢ WI-FI On Board‚Äù on buses using the new technology.

post_text:
Please join us for a moment of silence at 7:46AM

Today, as we remember one of the darkest moments in our nation‚Äôs history, let us also remember the way Americans united in the face of evil. May that unity and love of country continue to be a guiding light for our nation.
text:
Please join us for a moment of silence at 7:46AM

Today, as we remember one of the darkest moments in our nation‚Äôs history, let us also remember the way Americans united in the face of evil. May that unity and love of country continue to be a guiding light for our nation.

post_text:
"This Patriot Day, we commemorate the lives of those who perished on September 11, 2001, we pray for the families who carry on their legacies, and we honor the unmatched bravery of our Nation‚Äôs first responders. We also commend those who, in the days and years following the attack, answered the call to serve our country and continue to risk their lives in defense of the matchless blessings of freedom."- President Donald Trump

Please join us to participate in a community service in honor of the innocent people we lost that day and to observe a moment of silence at 7:46am to honor those victims who perished as a result of the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001.

FREE breakfast and lunch to all students!
Bandera ISD will be providing free breakfast and lunch meals to every Bandera ISD student. This will be a limited time offer.
Free meals will be available for all students regardless of meal application status until December 31, 2020 OR until state funding runs out. After this time, meal prices will return to your application status amount.

shared_text:
Alkek Elementary-Bandera ISD
September 3 at 6:45 PM ¬∑

Parents,
Due to the rain, we will have to use our alternate plan for drop off and pick up tomorrow. We will NOT be going through the field. Please enter the back lot, and follow the cones to snake through the parking lot. We will still have two lines for drop off, but those will start a little closer to the actual drop off area. If traffic gets backed up to transportation, we will have you enter transportation, go through their parking lot, and then exit back out onto 173. We will do this to keep as many cars as possible off of 173. Thank you for your cooperation with this.

Ticket Spicket UPDATE: Last night there was another small issue with ticket sales for Friday's varsity football game. Ticket sales were paused briefly and a message was displayed that the game was sold out - it is NOT sold out - and the issue has been fixed so sales are again open.

Currently sales are available for varsity team members only (4 tickets max). Sales for band/cheer/dance will open at noon (2 tickets max). The access code can be obtained from the activity's sponsor.

*** Please be advised that you will be screened for Covid-19 symptoms before being allowed entrance to the stadium - this includes a temperature check.

Band/ColorGuard parents need to fill out this attached form in order to receive the access code from Mr. Elrod this afternoon.
https://forms.gle/PiraCu4A9RRURVeN6

post_text: The Bandera FFA agronomy team is a brand new team consisting of Tessa Phillips, Sarah Guajardo, Lily Bitzkie, Carson Powers, and Cheyanne Collins. This team was made up entirely of outstanding 8th graders who were up for the challenge. The agronomy team focuses on Plant and Seed identification, common diseases of crops, insect/pest identification, soil composition and properties, agricultural math related to agronomy and general knowledge of plant science. This team spent countless hours studying and developing an understanding for this intense FFA contest. While their season got cut short due to COVID 19 and no state contest was held, the students are excited to get back into action and show their skills at the 2021 State contest!
text: The Bandera FFA agronomy team is a brand new team consisting of Tessa Phillips, Sarah Guajardo, Lily Bitzkie, Carson Powers, and Cheyanne Collins. This team was made up entirely of outstanding 8th graders who were up for the challenge. The agronomy team focuses on Plant and Seed identification, common diseases of crops, insect/pest identification, soil composition and properties, agricultural math related to agronomy and general knowledge of plant science. This team spent countless hours studying and developing an understanding for this intense FFA contest. While their season got cut short due to COVID 19 and no state contest was held, the students are excited to get back into action and show their skills at the 2021 State contest!

post_text: BISD's Back to School Bash was a huge success! To get back into school mode, families drove through the Lakehills Civic Center adorned with school spirit and eager staff. Students were outfitted with backpacks and school supplies. Thank you to all of the donors, volunteers, & BISD and Hill Country Samaritan staff. Our students are equipped and ready for another year of learning!

Bandera ISD
July 27 at 6:37 PM ¬∑

If you selected on-campus instruction when you completed the Bandera ISD Instructional Commitment Form, which is available on the BISD website, you will receive an email asking if your student(s) will be riding the bus. Your prompt response to the survey will allow Transportation Services ample time to make adjustments to routes with consideration to COVID-19 safety protocols. If you missed the survey in your inbox, you can access it directly here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdaVL_g-3DqVO6CPQh1ZBeBGv3eBYxsF2vlUTajNJwahAXY9w/viewform?usp=sf_link (NOTE: Emails will be sent once a day, so if you filled out the form later in the day today, you will receive the email tomorrow.)

shared_text:
Alkek Elementary-Bandera ISD
July 31 at 8:53 AM ¬∑

Alkek families:
Meet the teacher will be held on August 13. This year our meet the teacher will have a very different look.
If you have chosen remote instruction for your family, you will receive an invite from your child's teacher for a virtual meet the teacher. We will provide 3 opportunities 11:00 a.m, 2:00 p.m., and 6:00 p.m. **We will also have chromebooks and textbooks ready for checkout on campus for remote instruction families on August 13 from 8:30-6:00.
If you have chosen in-person instruction for your family, you will be receiving a phone call in the next week to set up a one on one meeting with your child's teacher on August 13 from 8:30 a.m - 6:00 p.m. These meetings will be set up in 15 minute intervals to give each family a chance to individually meet and greet with the teachers and drop off supplies. If you have multiple children at Alkek, we will work with you to try and set your meetings up back to back, so that you only have to come up to campus one time.

post_text:
The Instructional Commitment form to select on-campus or remote instruction closes on Monday at 3:00 pm. If you select on-campus instruction, please complete the transportation form, as well. The form to apply for meal assistance is available. Please visit the Back to School button at www.banderaisd.net to access all the forms.

Please note: all schedules viewable in Parent Portal are subject to change as the counselors balance classes to adjust to Instructional Commitment responses.

If you encounter trouble with registration, please email your student's campus for assistance. If there is no parent email in the registration system or if the email in registration does not match the parent email in Parent Portal, registration will not work correctly. Registration emails are available on the registration page on the Bandera website.

post_text: BISD is excited to offer online enrollment & registration this year. No more First Day Packets! Parents of returning students will need to log into Parent Portal to complete the registration process. If you need help with logging in, please contact your student's campus for assistance. Parents of new students, please go to Parent Portal and follow the instructions for NEW STUDENTS. ( NOTE: If you tried to get into Parent Portal earlier this weekend, you may have gotten an error message. Some features were unavailable as we migrated students from 2019-2020 to 2020-21. Parent Portal is now active.)

Remember, the form is open until 3:00 p.m. on August 3rd. All families must complete this form. You may access it here: https://sites.google.com/banderaisd2.net/back-to-school/road-to-reopening-plan

post_text: The BISD Instructional Commitment Form is available on the BISD website. The deadline for completing the form is Monday, August 3, 2020, at 3:00 pm. Prompt completion of the commitment will allow BISD ample time to make staffing adjustments to accommodate each instructional model.

post_text:
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.
P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT
shared_text:

P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT

post_text:
An Important Change about Bandera High School‚Äôs Graduation

Throughout the week, BISD officials have been closely monitoring the weather forecasts for Bandera on Friday. Most weather sites are predicting between a 50-60% chance of precipitation for Friday, including multiple days of rain over the weekend and early next week. Most of the same sites are predicting no rain on Thursday.

In order to have the celebration in a way that is rain-free and appropriately honors our graduating seniors, we have made the decision to move the 2020 BHS Graduation Ceremony to Thursday, May 21st, at 7:00 p.m. at Alkek Field (located between Alkek Elementary and the BISD Transportation Facility). We are fully aware that this provides some logistical challenges for our families, but our goal is to make this celebration happen in a way that is fitting for our outstanding Class of 2020. Please continue to monitor www.banderaisd.net for the latest updates.

Bandera Middle School PTO
May 8 at 2:45 PM ¬∑

Incoming 6th grade parents!
We are excited for you to join the BMS PTO team! If you are excited or even scared about your kiddo starting middle school then this is the perfect place to get involved. The PTO is well connected with the admin and teachers making it a great place to stay informed and get involved. Nominations for the board are taking place online this year. If you are interested or know someone that would be great for a position, please share this post with them and invite them to respond.

post_text: There are no words that can adequately express BISD's appreciation for the amazingly dedicated men and women who teach the children in Bandera schools. These professionals have gone above and beyond in their creative and innovative measures to teach, tend, and love their students during the COVID-19 school closure. If you have the opportunity this week, please reach out to wish a teacher Happy Teacher Appreciation Week! #smalltownBandera #banderapride #banderaintegrity.

Bandera Bulldogs Football
April 29 at 4:43 PM ¬∑

Don't forget that tomorrow (Thursday 4/30) is your second opportunity for locker pick up and equipment check at the high school for athletics: 8-10 AM. 5-7 PM

If you are picking up athletics locker contents, you will follow the signs alongside the stadium and pull up to one of two designated pick up areas (a huge cone). You will roll down your window and tell the coach your name and then we will have a bag containing the contents of your locker dropped off outside your car, at which time you will get out of the car, and collect your bag and then drive on.

Drop off equipment at next area

shared_text:
Bandera Middle School-Bandera ISD
April 28 at 2:58 PM ¬∑

BMS locker clean out

Dear BMS Athletes, 4/28/2020

Please come retrieve your personal belongings from your athletic locker! We have 3 curbside pick up times for you to choose from. We will be doing curbside on Wednesday April 29th from 8:00 am to 10:00 am, Thursday April 30th from 8:00 am to 10:00 am AND again on Thursday 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm.
If you have clothing or equipment that belongs to the school please bring it to our drop off station at that time.
We will be set up on Cherry street in front of the gym. Please stay in your car until it is time to get your things. We must maintain social distancing throughout this process.
Coaches and staff will be present to give directions.

Sincerely,
BMS Coaching Staff

BMS locker clean out

Dear BMS Athletes, 4/28/2020

Please come retrieve your personal belongings from your athletic locker! We have 3 curbside pick up times for you to choose from. We will be doing curbside on Wednesday April 29th from 8:00 am to 10:00 am, Thursday April 30th from 8:00 am to 10:00 am AND again on Thursday 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm.
If you have clothing or equipment that belongs to the school please bring it to our drop off station at that time.
We will be set up on Cherry street in front of the gym. Please stay in your car until it is time to get your things. We must maintain social distancing throughout this process.
Coaches and staff will be present to give directions.

Sincerely,
BMS Coaching Staff

shared_text:
Bandera Middle School-Bandera ISD
April 17 at 12:18 PM ¬∑

Band Students and Parents,

Thank everyone for their help with the last instrument pickup at Bandera MS. It was a complete success and we could not have done it without your cooperation. There have been a few requests to still pick up instruments. Mr. Elrod will be hosting another instrument pickup drive at Bandera MS from 5 PM to 6 PM on Friday April 17. Please pull your vehicle to the door of the band hall through the bus loop at Bandera MS. Once Mr. Elrod has identified who is picking up an instrument, he will retrieve the instrument and bring it to the next door, where you can pick it up. Thank you for your support and keep practicing!

--
Travis Elrod
Director of Bands
Bandera Middle School

post_text: Today, Governor Abbott announced that all schools in Texas are closed through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Please stay tuned to Bandera ISD for information regarding the impact this will have on school work, end-of-the-year events, and all other related topics. For more information, see https://tinyurl.com/y8t5nv9k

Advanced Academics-Bandera ISD
April 16 at 11:59 AM ¬∑

The NEW dates and times for AP testing during Covid have been updated. Students can find them on the Advanced Academics Google Classroom (if this link doesn't work).

Students should be receiving emails from College Board regarding testing updates. If you are not receiving them, please log in to your CB/AP account and update your personal email address.

There is a Parent/Student webinar with Trevor Packer, the head of the AP Program, at 6:00 tonight to discuss how at-home testing will work. I'll share the registration link ASAP.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fEBY340Dk-AWnLaEGMLxlpFdEPMI0d54dwYF5UwLbkM/edit?usp=sharing

There is a Parent/Student webinar with Trevor Packer, the head of the AP Program, at 6:00 tonight to discuss how at-home testing will work. I'll share the registration link ASAP.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fEBY340Dk-AWnLaEGMLxlpFdEPMI0d54dwYF5UwLbkM/edit?usp=sharing

Dr. Seuss
March 27 at 12:23 PM ¬∑

‚ÄúHorton Hears a Who‚Äù by @drseuss - read by @jeffgoldblum
Published by Random House Children's Books
.
THIRTY MILLION CHILDREN rely on school for food. Responding to the needs of kids during these school closures, @savethechildren and @nokidhungry have a new fund @SAVEWITHSTORIES to support food banks, and mobile meal trucks, and community feeding programs with funds to do what they do best‚Äîand also‚Äîwith educational toys, books, and worksheets to make sure brains are full, as well as bellies.
.
If you can manage a one time gift of $10, please text SAVE to 20222. If another amount would work better for you, please visit our website‚Äîlink in bio. There is no maximum and there is no minimum‚Äîtogether we will rise and together we can help.
.
Thank you and stay safe. XX
#SAVEWITHSTORIES

**Updated** This form is now closed. We've had 194 requests so far and only have 125 desks. The families that will receive desks based on the time stamp of their form submission will receive an email today.

Need a desk for your learning space at home? BISD has 125 surplus desks destined for disposal because they were not bid on in the November auction. Visit http://tinyurl.com/surplusdesk to fill out a form by noon on 4/1/20. Desks will be available for pick up from 10-1 on Wednesday.

post_text: Another big thank you to Erin Moore of Hill Country Elementary for some helpful tips on working on your documents when you don't have internet. We're in Day 8 of Distance Learning in BISD, and it's been a challenge for students and parents and teachers alike. Our small-town community is working together and supporting each other as we travel unfamiliar paths. Thank you for your patience. Thank you for your support. Thank you for your questions. We are growing together! (This video will be pinned on the Technical Support link on our Learning@Home site shortly.)

I have created a sign-up sheet for BHS Band members to come pick up their instruments and band folders. Some of you need to complete video assessments and all students need to keep up their playing skills. The time slots are in 10-minute intervals because we can only have one student at a time in the Band Hall. The times listed are when I am most available to be there this week, so please try to make it during those times. Email me if there is a problem. Here is the link. This is also posted in the BHS Marching Band Google Classroom, and Mr. Martin is sending a Remind with the link.

shared_text:
Bandera High School-Bandera ISD
March 22 at 10:04 PM ¬∑

Bulldogs,
Monday, March 23 is the start of our BHS distance learning program. Whether you call it virtual learning, learning from home, or just good ole‚Äô Google Classroom, it is important to check in with your 4 core academic teachers (no electives this week). If you don‚Äôt already know how to link up, just go to the BISD webpage and click on the COVID-19 School Closure Information button, and then to Learning@Home button to scroll and find the right link.
Teachers will offer posted assignments, reviews, resources, prerecorded instruction, and/or the times and dates of live instruction & virtual classroom check-ins with your class.
Think of this as a new, first day of school!
We hope that you are excited and ready to go. Your teachers have been working hard at putting this all together, so get after it, like a true Bulldog!

shared_text:
Advanced Academics-Bandera ISD
March 16 at 3:27 PM ¬∑

The latest update from SAT-

In response to the rapidly evolving situation around the coronavirus (COVID-19) and guidance from public health organizations, the College Board is canceling the May 2, 2020, SAT¬Æ administration. Makeup exams for the March 14 administration (scheduled March 28) are also canceled. We will provide refunds to all students who are registered for May, whose March test centers were closed, or who do not receive March scores due to an irregularity.

Our top priority is the health and safety of students and educators.

If BHS is able to offer a June test, we will let you know!

All eleven Choir Students who competed Friday, February 28, 2020, in the Regional Solo and Ensemble Contest held at Bandera High School have qualified to advance to the Texas State Solo and Ensemble Contest which will be held on May 30th!!

Each of these outstanding students had to prepare a song from memory and each received Superior ratings for his/her performance.

post_text:
Congratulations to Kirsten Wedgworth . Kirsten competed at the State TAFE (Teachers Association of Future Educators) Convention in McAllen against 33 schools across Texas in the ‚ÄúShadowing a Non-Core Teacher‚Äù event. She placed in the TOP 5, making her a National Qualifier!

Mrs. Morgan Groff, the TAFE sponsor, said, "I am so proud of the hard work and dedication this girl puts into TAFE and the Education program at Bandera High School! There is nothing more rewarding then seeing my kids succeed! I want to send a BIG thank you to Stacey Clark for allowing Kirsten to shadow you in your classroom! "

Sign up attached - starting at 3:30 until 10.

post_text:
Makayla Childers has been selected from thousands of applicants across the nation as one of the top eight finalists for Varsity Spirit Mascot competition. Makayla is eligible to attend the awards ceremony in May. The winner will receive a $3000 award!
According to BHS Cheer sponsor Kim Mooney, "Makayla is the most special, spirited and positive leader and mascot, and warms the hearts of all who know her. She is dedicated to her peers and teams and school and always encourages and uplifts them, never complaining or quitting!" Makayla is a national award winning competitive cheerleader for her Kinectickids team. She is applying to Texas A&M University for a possible admission to a program called Aggie ACHIEVE, so we are wishing her the very best of luck in everything she is pursuing. https://www.varsitybrands.com/awards/categories

post_text:
BHS UIL Boerne Invitational Results: The Academics, Speech, and Debate teams competed at the Boerne Invitational this past weekend. There were 25 schools of all sizes competing, and it was a tough day of contests. But, our Bulldogs had a great day and came home with several awards! In addition, the Speech team won first place Sweepstakes!

Individual congratulations go to:
Duggan Persyn - 1st place Science, 1st place Chemistry, 5th place Number Sense, 6th place Mathematics

Cade Koenig - 3rd place Science

Ryan Molnar - 3rd place Computer Applications

Robert Rittiman - 7th place Computer Science

Griffin Morsi - 6th place Computer Science

Aidan Prater- 1st place Lincoln Douglas Debate

Michael Nevarez- 1st place Prose

Ryan Zimmel- 4th place Informative Speaking

In addition, the Speech team won first place Sweepstakes!

Individual congratulations go to:

shared_text:
Alkek Elementary-Bandera ISD
February 4 at 10:07 AM ¬∑

Tomorrow is National Read Aloud Day!!

World Read Aloud Day is happening on February 5, 2020! The worldwide event from Scholastic and the global literacy nonprofit LitWorld calls attention to reading aloud and sharing stories. Now in its 11th year and celebrated in over 173 countries, World Read Aloud Day is a wonderful reminder of the power and importance of this best practice.

An abundance of research points to how reading aloud is both beneficial and beloved!

Grab a book and a buddy, its time to read!

post_text:
National School Counseling Week, sponsored by the American School Counselor Association, highlights the tremendous impact school counselors can have in helping students achieve school success and plan for a career.
The 2020 theme is "School Counselors: Helping Build Better Humans."
If you see our school counselors on campus this week, join us in giving them a big thank you! Lisa Holdbrook (AES), Robyn Langston (HCE), Courtney Casebier (BMS), and Oscar Garcia & Summer Van (BHS).

post_text: BHS One Act Play students reported to the high school this past weekend for twelve hours of intensive rehearsal over two days to prep for the upcoming season. At the end of the day on Saturday, they were the special guests at The New Buddy Holly Band's concert, leading the crowd in the Twist and the Swim at the end of the show. Ms. Huber said, "They were so precious, and I received many wonderful compliments from the older generation on how special it was to have Bandera students there to share in their own teenage nostalgia." Good luck on your season, BHS! https://youtu.be/vu99vFaP5os
shared_text:
YOUTUBE.COM
BHS One Act Play Retreat
text:
BHS One Act Play students reported to the high school this past weekend for twelve hours of intensive rehearsal over two days to prep for the upcoming season. At the end of the day on Saturday, they were the special guests at The New Buddy Holly Band's concert, leading the crowd in the Twist and the Swim at the end of the show. Ms. Huber said, "They were so precious, and I received many wonderful compliments from the older generation on how special it was to have Bandera students there to share in their own teenage nostalgia." Good luck on your season, BHS! https://youtu.be/vu99vFaP5os

Bandera High School-Bandera ISD

So... BHS asked our students if they were interested in starting an E-Sports (competitive video gaming) program to compete against other Texas high schools. The Big 12 is doing this at the college level, and last year the Esports World Championship had more viewers than the Super Bowl. Today was the first meeting.
I think our kids are interested!!ü§†

post_text:
Congrats to BHS Speech and Debate. #statebound

The teams participated in the District contest this week. What fabulous results!
The following teams placed:
the team of Gunnar Winkler and Kelly Columbia- 2nd place (state qualifiers)
the team of Katelyn Mendez and Elijah Sarazua- 5th place
the team of Devlyn Cadena and Adisyn Utter- 6th place

The Bandera squad also won 1st place CX team.

CX Sweepstakes points will go toward the spring meet Academic District contest in March.

SchoolPoints

Bandera HS, Bandera 30

Wimberley HS, Wimberley 22

Boerne HS, Boerne 20

These students began preparing for contest in July, began competing in September, and have since traveled to five invitationals in order to prepare for the district meet yesterday. They will compete at State on March 20 and 21 in Austin. The four non-qualifiers will now begin competing in their alternate events and will have a chance at Regionals in March.

#banderapride

post_text: Bandera ISD values choices in learning because we believe choice cultivates personal growth and individual pride. post_text:
The BHS Speech and Debate team had a great day at the Karnes City Invitational!

Congratulations!

Devlyn Cadena and Adisyn Utter- Quarter Finals CX Debate
Aidan Prater - 1st LD Debate (his first tournament win) and 2nd Persuasive Speaking
Michael Nevarez - 5th Prose
Kelly Columbia - 4th Prose
Ethan Molnar - 3rd Prose
Alena Swan - 3rd Poetry

And, the Novice team of Donavan Brown and Cole Grothues went 2-1 in CX debate, missing quarterfinals by 3 points at their first tournament together.

Michael Nevarez - 5th Prose
Kelly Columbia - 4th Prose
Ethan Molnar - 3rd Prose
Alena Swan - 3rd Poetry

And, the Novice team of Donavan Brown and Cole Grothues went 2-1 in CX debate, missing quarterfinals by 3 points at their first tournament together.

Great job! ü§†

post_text:
You are invited to support our Academic Decathlon: On Saturday, December 14th, Bandera High School Decathlon team will host the Round 1 Super Quiz competition. Twenty-five schools will be competing to see which is the best at answering quiz questions in front of a crowd.

Super Quiz is the only part of the competition that is open to the public. The event will be held at 3:00 pm in the high school gym, and spectators and fans are encouraged to attend.

(The Bandera team will be competing, but they have excused themselves from the possibility of trophies since they are hosting.)

post_text:
On Wednesday, November 13th, the Bandera FFA chapter competed in the Revaldina district Leadership Development Events held in Hondo Texas. Placing first was: Broadcasting team consisting of Jayden Coiner, Abby Jones, and Sidney Timmons; Kate Guajardo in the Senior Creed Speaking contest; and Tessa Phillips, Lily Bitzkie, Sarah Guajardo, and in the Junior Quiz contest. Chelsey Graves also competed and placed second in Job Interview. All first and second place finishers will advance to the Area VII competition on Wednesday, November 20th in Blanco.
Also competing at the district contest and placing third was Public Relations, Junior Skills, and Senior Skills. Ag Advocacy placed fourth and Junior Creed speaking placed sixth.

post_text: Three BHS Choir Members Advance to Area: Congratulations to Ethan Ellingson (Senior), Zakary Widenor (Senior), and Rebecca Ellingson (Sophomore), for qualifying to advance to the All Area Choir Auditions. These three outstanding choir students competed at the Pre Area Auditions this week held at Boerne HS. They will compete again in January at Cuero HS for the chance to become a member of the 2020 All State Small School Choir.

post_text: Lady Bulldogs Basketball by Coach Dumont: The Bandera Lady Bulldogs had their season opener on Friday November 8th versus Hondo and came away with a sound victory. After two scrimmages and many days of practice the Lady Dogs were ready to step on the floor and get after it in their first game of the year. The Lady Dogs came out hungry for the ball and fired up, playing great defense holding Hondo to only 5 points in the first quarter. Along with stellar defense the Lady Dogs put up many good shots and had several fall to score 13 points of their own in the first quarter. At halftime the Lady Dogs were up 21-14 but didn‚Äôt relax and came out after the break with a strong 3rd quarter. The Lady Dogs only allowed Hondo to score 4 points in the third and had a great quarter on the offensive end where they put up 18 points. To close the game the Lady Dogs continued to play exceptional defense and compete until the last buzzer went off. The Bandera Lady Bulldogs beat Hondo 45-26.

SENIOR NIGHT! Parents, this is how senior night is going to go. Football players will be recognized before the game on Friday. All other seniors involved in the football experience (band, dance, color guard, trainers, cheer) will be announced during half time. ALL other seniors present will be announced after the game one at a time, on the walking track.

If you have a senior that you would like recognized after the game, please submit it to Mr. Koerlin. The information he will need is: Student name, parents' names, 2 accomplishments, and/or plans after high school.

Once everyone has been recognized, all seniors will take a victory lap to their senior song. Parents are invited to take the lap with them.

post_text:
Cross Country News by Coach Ashcraft: On Monday, October 28th, the Bandera Lady Bulldog Cross Country Team competed in the
2019 Region IV Cross Country Regional Championships in Corpus Christi. The top four teams
in each division qualify out as well as the top 15 individuals who did not qualify out on teams.
The Lady Bulldogs fought hard and qualified in the second spot as a team earning a silver
medal with a team total of 156 points behind Liberty Hill who placed first. Elexis Pearson lead
the team with a 23rd place. Caitlyn Thrasher came in second for the team placing 29th, Morgan
Cole was 32nd, Hannah Edwards was 35th, Raelynn Butler was 37th, Jordan Edwards 28th,
and Corinne McMullan placed 47th. The Lady Bulldogs will compete at the 2019 State Cross
Country Meet on November 9th at Old Settlers Park in Round Rock at 12:00pm.

post_text: We have received information from the Texas attorney general's office that the previously distributed information is not accurate. There is not a credible threat against a school in Texas. In an abundance of caution, we acted in the best interest of student safety. The "hold and secure" is lifted," and classes will resume as normal.
text: We have received information from the Texas attorney general's office that the previously distributed information is not accurate. There is not a credible threat against a school in Texas. In an abundance of caution, we acted in the best interest of student safety. The "hold and secure" is lifted," and classes will resume as normal.
